content.description: Project on East/Souteast Face. Top rope...belay anchor off the pine if you want.
content.protection: Top rope...belay anchor off the pine if you want or bring friends and pads.
content.location: Project on East/Souteast Face. Top rope....belay anchor off the pine if you want.

content.description:
Climb the right-leaning arete on the left side of the east face.

It has good hands and shitty feet. Walk off the ramp back toward your east face start.

Bouldering Colorado

rated this problem a V3.
content.protection: A great landing...I have cleared most all debris and all but one rock that is not in the way. A pad is great for the sit start variation of this problem. This problem tops out a little high, but it has a bomber landing for sure.
content.location: This is on the left side of the east face...the obvious, right-leaning arete.

content.description: This is on the West/ Southwest face.... It is a top rope route  around 45 feet tall. There is a good belay station down in the boulders. A #2 Big bro made for a bomber anchor back under the boulders. Set anchors up top off the huge aspen and pine trees with the third being a nut or hex in a small crack near the face.
content.protection: Top rope, it has a shitty landing. There is a good belay station below in the boulders and a decent anchor built up top off the big trees.
content.location: This is on the West/ Southwest face facing the road...you will get lots of people stopping to watch.
